intro: Myrobalanus fatraea, commonly known as the fatraean tamarind, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically harvested when mature. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its unique ecological role, it is considered an important species for local biodiversity.
